title: Fact-check: Nigeria state governor’s claims about stellar education record not backed by the data
subtitle: Ekiti state governor, Kayode Fayemi, claims school enrolment and other key education markers in the state had fallen precipitously under the previous administration but that he has reversed them. We checked.
author: africacheck.org
vclaim:
• None There is a long rivalry between the All Progressives Congress and the People’s Democratic Party in Ekiti state, often finding expression in claims about the state’s quality of education.
• None State governor Kayode Fayemi, who is serving his second term, added fuel to the fire when he claimed that under his previous leadership, school enrolment rose to 96%, only to fall to the “least in the South West” by 2018, under PDP rule.
• None Fayemi said he was once again reversing the trend, bringing enrolment above 75% because of the introduction of free education. But his claims are at best unproven and at worst entirely incorrect.
